summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul an Apostle (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father which hath raised him from the dead.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the brethren which are with me unto the Churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with you, and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world according to the will of God even our Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom be glory forever and ever, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed away unto another Gospel, from him that had called you in the grace of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is not another Gospel, save that there be some which trouble you, and intend to pervert the Gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But though that we, or an Angel from heaven preach unto you otherwise than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach unto you otherwise than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now preach I man’s doctrine, or God’s? or go I about to please men? for if I should yet please men, I were not the servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I certify you, brethren, that the Gospel which was preached of me, was not after man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither received I it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past, in the Jewish religion, how that I persecuted the Church of God extremely, and wasted it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And profited in the Jewish religion above many of my companions of mine own nation, and was much more zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when it pleased God (which had separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I should preach him among the Gentiles immediately, I communicated not with flesh and blood:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither came I again to Jerusalem to them which were Apostles before me, but I went into Arabia, and turned again unto Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after three years I came again to Jerusalem, to visit Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And none other of the Apostles saw I, save James the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, I witness before God, that I lie not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, I went into the coasts of Syria and Cilicia: for I was unknown by face unto the Churches of Judea which were in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they had heard only some say, He which persecuted us in time past, now preacheth the faith which before he destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they glorified God for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fourteen years after, I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took with me Titus also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I went up by revelation, and declared unto them that Gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but particularly to them that were the chief, lest by any means I should run, or had run in vain:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither yet Titus which was with me, though he were a Grecian, was compelled to be circumcised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To wit, for the false brethren which were craftily sent in, and crept in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom we gave not place by subjection for an hour, that the truth of the Gospel might continue with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by them which seemed to be great, I was not taught (whatsoever they were in time passed, I am nothing the better: God accepteth no man’s person) for they that are the chief, did add nothing to me above that I had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But contrariwise, when they saw that the Gospel over the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the Gospel over the circumcision was unto Peter:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he that was mighty by Peter in the Apostleship over the circumcision, was also mighty by me toward the Gentiles.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when James, and Cephas, and John, knew of the grace that was given unto me, which are counted to be pillars, they gave to me and to Barnabas the right hands of fellowship, that we should preach unto the Gentiles, and they unto the circumcision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Warning only that we should remember the poor: which thing also I was diligent to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face: for he was to be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before that certain came from James, he ate with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other Jews played the hypocrites likewise with him, insomuch that Barnabas was led away with them by that their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw, that they went not the right way to the truth of the Gospel, I said unto Peter before all men, If thou being a Jew, livest as the Gentiles, and not like the Jews, why constrainest thou the Gentiles to do like the Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We which are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know that a man is not justified by the works of the Law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we, I say, have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the Law, because that by the works of the Law, no flesh shall be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then while we seek to be made righteous by Christ, we ourselves are found sinners, is Christ therefore the minister of sin? God forbid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I build again the things that I have destroyed, I make myself a trespasser.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I through the Law am dead to the Law, that I might live unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am crucified with Christ, but I live, yet not I anymore, but Christ liveth in me: and in that I now live in the flesh, I live by the faith in the Son of God, who hath loved me, and given himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not abrogate the grace of God: for if righteousness be by the Law, then Christ died without a cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, to whom Jesus Christ before was described in your sight, and among you crucified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the Law, or by the hearing of faith preached?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are ye so foolish, that after ye have begun in the Spirit, ye would now be made perfect by the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if so be it be even in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it through the works of the Law, or by the hearing of faith preached?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea rather as Abraham believed God, and it was imputed to him for righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye therefore, that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Scripture foreseeing, that God would justify the Gentiles through faith, preached before the Gospel unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all the Gentiles be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then they which be of faith, are blessed with faithful Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many as are of the works of the Law, are under the curse: For it is written, Cursed is every man that continueth not in all things, which are written in the book of the Law, to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that no man is justified by the Law in the sight of God, it is evident: for the just shall live by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Law is not of faith: but the man that shall do those things, shall live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the Law, made a curse for us, (for it is written, Cursed is everyone that hangeth on tree.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, I speak as men do: though it be but a man’s covenant, when it is confirmed, yet no man doth abrogate it, or addeth anything thereto,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He saith not, and to the seeds, as speaking of many: but, And to thy seed, as of one, which is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say, that the covenant that was confirmed afore of God in respect of Christ, the Law which was four hundred and thirty years after, cannot disannul, that it should make the promise of none effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance be of the Law, it is no more by the promise, but God gave it freely unto Abraham by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore then serveth the Law? It was added because of the transgressions, till the seed came, unto the which the promise was made: and it was ordained by Angels in the hand of a Mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a Mediator is not a Mediator of one: but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the Law then against the promises of God? God forbid: For if there had been a Law given which could have given life, surely righteousness should have been by the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by the faith of Jesus Christ should be given to them that believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before faith came, we were kept under the Law, as under a garrison, and shut up unto that faith, which should afterward be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the Law was our schoolmaster to bring us to Christ, that we might be made righteous by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are all the sons of God by faith, in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all ye that are baptized into Christ, have put on Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is neither Jew nor Grecian: there is neither bond nor free: there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye be Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I say, that the heir as long as he is a child, differeth nothing from a servant, though he be Lord of all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But is under tutors and governors, until the time appointed of the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the rudiments of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fullness of time was come, God sent forth his Son made of a woman, and made under the Law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That he might redeem them which were under the Law, that we might receive the adoption of the sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, which crieth, Abba, Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, thou art no more a servant, but a son: now if thou be a son, thou art also the heir of God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them, which by nature are not gods:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now seeing ye know God, yea, rather are known of God, how turn ye again unto impotent and beggarly rudiments, whereunto as from the beginning ye will be in bondage again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am in fear of you, lest I have bestowed on you labor in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye as I (for I am even as you) brethren, I beseech you: ye have not hurt me at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye know, how through infirmity of the flesh, I preached the Gospel unto you at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the trial of me which was in my flesh, ye despised not, neither abhorred: but ye received me as an Angel of God, yea, as Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was then your felicity? for I bear you record, that if it had been possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes, and have given them unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are jealous over you amiss: yea, they would exclude you, that ye should altogether love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is a good thing to love earnestly always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, of whom I travail in birth again, until Christ be formed in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I would I were with you now, that I might change my voice: for I am in doubt of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, ye that will be under the Law, do ye not hear the Law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, one by a servant, and one by a free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he which was of the servant, was born after the flesh: and he which was of the free woman, was born by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the which things another thing is meant: for these mothers are the two Testaments, the one which is Hagar of mount Sinai, which gendereth unto bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For Hagar or Sinai is a mountain in Arabia, and it answered to Jerusalem which now is) and she is in bondage with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jerusalem, which is above, is free: which is the mother of us all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, Rejoice thou barren that bearest no children: break forth, and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children, than she which hath an husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brethren, we are after the manner of Isaac, children of the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as then he that was born after the flesh, persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, even so it is now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what saith the Scripture? Put out the servant and her son: for the son of the servant shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then brethren, we are not children of the servant, but of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify again to every man, which is circumcised, that he is bound to keep the whole Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are abolished from Christ: whosoever are justified by the Law, ye are fallen from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth anything, neither uncircumcision, but faith which worketh by love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye did run well: who did let you, that ye did not obey the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not the persuasion of him that calleth you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little leaven doth leaven the whole lump.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have trust in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you, shall bear his condemnation, whosoever he be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? Then is the slander of the cross abolished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Would to God they were even cut off which do disquiet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For brethren, ye have been called unto liberty: only use not your liberty as an occasion unto the flesh, but by love serve one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the Law is fulfilled in one word, which is this, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye bite and devour one another, take heed lest ye be consumed one of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I say, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfill the lusts of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary one to another, so that ye cannot do the same things that ye would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye be led by the Spirit, ye are not under the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the works of the flesh are manifest, which are adultery, fornication, uncleanness, wantonness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, debate, emulations, wrath, contentions, seditions, heresies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Envy, murders, drunkenness, gluttony, and such like, whereof I tell you before, as I also have told you before, that they which do such things, shall not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meekness, temperancy: against such there is no law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they that are Christ’s, have crucified the flesh with the affections and the lusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not be desirous of vainglory, provoking one another, envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, If a man be suddenly taken in any offense, ye which are spiritual, restore such one with the spirit of meekness, considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear ye one another’s burden, and so fulfill the Law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if any man seem to himself, that he is somewhat, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself in his imagination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let every man prove his own work: and then shall he have rejoicing in himself only and not in another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every man shall bear his own burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him that is taught in the word, make him that hath taught him, partaker of all his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not deceived: God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that soweth to his flesh, shall of the flesh reap corruption: but he that soweth to the spirit, shall of the spirit reap life everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not therefore be weary of well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While we have therefore time, let us do good unto all men, but especially unto them, which are of the household of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised, only because they would not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they themselves which are circumcised keep not the Law, but desire to have you circumcised, that they might rejoice in your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God forbid that I should rejoice, but in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, whereby the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace shall be upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From henceforth let no man put me to business: for I bear, in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, Amen.
Unto the Galatians written from Rome.
verses.speaker: Narrator
